1:
Surely God is good to Israel,\q to those with a pure heart.
\q
2:
But as for me, my feet almost slipped;\q my feet almost slipped out from under me
\q
3:
because I was envious of the arrogant\q when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.


\q
4:
For they have no pain until their death,\q but they are strong and well fed.
\q
5:
They are free from the burdens of other men;\q they are not afflicted like other men.


\q
6:
Pride adorns them like a necklace around their neck;\q violence clothes them like a robe.
\q
7:
Out of such blindness comes sin;\q evil thoughts pass through their hearts.


\q
8:
They mock and speak wickedly;\q in their arrogance they threaten oppression.
\q
9:
They set their mouth against the heavens,\q and their tongues march through the earth.


\q
10:
Therefore his people turn to them\q and abundant waters are drained out.
\q
11:
They say, "How does God know?\q Is there knowledge with the Most High?"
\q
12:
Take notice: these people are wicked;\q they are always carefree, becoming richer and richer.


\q
13:
Surely it is in vain that I have guarded my heart\q and washed my hands in innocence.
\q
14:
For all the day long I have been afflicted\q and disciplined every morning.
\q
15:
If I had said, "I will say these things,"\q then I would have betrayed this generation of your children.


\q
16:
Though I tried to understand these things,\q it was too difficult for me.
\q
17:
Then I went into God's sanctuary\q and came to understand their fate.


\q
18:
Surely you put them in slippery places;\q you bring them down to ruin.
\q
19:
How they become a wilderness in a moment!\q They come to an end and are finished in awful terrors.
\q
20:
They are like a dream after one wakes up;\q2 Lord, when you arise, you will think nothing of those dreams.


\q
21:
For my heart was grieved,\q and I was deeply wounded.
\q
22:
I was ignorant and lacked insight;\q I was like a senseless animal before you.


\q
23:
Yet I am always with you;\q you hold my right hand.
\q
24:
You will guide me with your advice\q and afterward receive me to glory.


\q
25:
Whom have I in heaven but you?\q There is no one on earth that I desire but you.
\q
26:
My flesh and my heart grow weak,\q but God is the strength of my heart forever.


\q
27:
Those who are far from you will perish;\q you will destroy all those who are unfaithful
to you.
\q
28:
But as for me, all I need to do is to approach God.\q I have made the Lord Yahweh my refuge.
\q I will declare all your deeds.
